weapon.mod.small.scope.name: 8×スコープ
weapon.mod.small.scope.description: The 8x Zoom Scope is a hand-crafted telescopic sight. Its reticle is simply a thin cross. Its magnification allows for greater precision over long ranges and extending most weapon's range, but is not ideal for close quarter engagements.

rifle.ak.name: アサルトライフル
rifle.ak.description:
The Assault Rifle is an accurate, powerful, and fully automatic rifle that fires 5.56 rifle rounds. It has a moderate rate of fire which allows for proficiency at close to medium range.

Strong recoil makes it more difficult to fire in full-auto at long range, but experienced users may be able to control it more effectively.

The Assault Rifle is generally used as an end-game multipurpose weapon, able to take fights at any range.

grenade.beancan.name: 豆缶のグレネード
grenade.beancan.description: The Beancan Grenade is an early-game tool. They're used to craft Satchel Charges, but can be used by themselves in raiding. The Beancan Grenade has a random detonation period and can kill a player if it's within the range. The Beancan Grenade has a 15% chance to be a dud. However, Beancan Grenades have a 50% chance to explode when you attempt to pick them up again after a dud.

rifle.bolt.name: ボルトアクション式スナイパー
rifle.bolt.description: The Bolt Action Rifle is a powerful late game rifle that offers high accuracy and high damage at the cost of speed. Having the most damage and least spread of any weapon, it is often used as a designated sniper rifle, and is commonly fitted with a scope to increase the sight range for the user. Its slow rate of fire greatly limits its use in close quarters combat, and its limited capacity forces users to take shots very carefully. Having a very fast bullet velocity, users need not lead targets or compensate for gravity as much as with other weapons firing a slower bullet.

bone.club.name: 骨こんぼう
bone.club.description: The Bone Club is a cheap, simple to craft melee weapon of the early game. Despite its shortcomings, the Bone Club serves as an upgrade to the Rock, being better at both harvesting resources and fighting.

knife.bone.name: ボーンナイフ
knife.bone.description: An early game weapon made out of bone. Very good to have early on due to it harvesting the most out of hunted animals (or humans!)

knife.butcher.name: ブッチャー ナイフ
knife.butcher.description: A sharp butcher knife. Extremely good at harvesting flesh from both dead or alive bodies.

candycaneclub.name: キャンディケインクラブ
candycaneclub.description: The Candy Cane Club is much better used as a Food or Medical item rather than a Melee weapon as it's damage is comparable to the Bone club.

knife.combat.name: コンバット ナイフ
knife.combat.description:
The Combat Knife is an extremely useful melee weapon that required Tier 1 workbench to craft, basically an upgraded bone knife. Its exquisite design structure makes it the best skinning efficiency among similar melees, which means you can get the full loot from skinning with shortest time. Its cheap cost makes it the most cost-effective farming tool.
You can untie the creates underwater with combat knife, and attack while running.

bow.compound.name: コンパウンドボウ
bow.compound.description:
The Compound Bow is the most powerful bow. It can one shot someone with full gear. Pulling the bow while keeping stationary will increase the velocity and damage of the arrow.

As of December 2021, the Compound Bow received a nerf. You can no longer find it in default blueprints. You also can't pull the string on the Compound Bow for too long, otherwise it loses durability overtime.

crossbow.name: クロスボウ
crossbow.description: The Crossbow is a low-tier weapon that can fire either a high-velocity or regular arrow a decent distance. It is capable of relatively high damage, and is a great option when paired with a Waterpipe Shotgun or Eoka Pistol or Nailgun.

smg.2.name: カスタムSMG
smg.2.description: The Custom SMG is a quick-firing, low damage submachine gun with moderate recoil. Its moderate spread and low bullet velocity limit the use of the weapon to close and possibly moderate ranges, but its maximum range can be extended through the use of attachments like the Silencer or Weapon Lasersight to increase accuracy. The Custom SMG is the least expensive submachine gun, and fires the quickest out of every weapon in the game. With no movement penalty, like other SMGs, this weapon is most effectively used while on the move.

shotgun.double.name: ダブルバレル ショットガン
shotgun.double.description:
The Double Barrel Shotgun is a lower tier, close ranged weapon capable of one-hitting enemies within its effective range. It's best used in conjunction with other, longer range guns and against only one or two enemies at a time since it can only shoot two shells before requiring a lengthy reload. Furthermore, shots should only be made with it if it's likely that the majority of the pellets in a blast will connect with their target.

It makes for a strong early game weapon because of its relatively low cost. If the extra resources are available, it's a much safer and more reliable investment than the Waterpipe Shotgun since it's not as dependent on a single shot killing an enemy. Generally, unless going into an engagement that has large group of possible enemies (like a base raid or supply drop), it'll most likely be more cost effective to take a Double Barrel over a Pump Shotgun.

pistol.eoka.name: eoka ピストル
pistol.eoka.description:
The Eoka Pistol is a very cheap, very ineffective, and very unreliable firearm. It fires shotgun ammunition in a wide arc, and is capable of killing opponents in one hit (however unlikely that is).
The Eoka pistol consists of a spent 20mm cartridge with a small hole on top attached to a crude wooden frame. A shotgun shell is loaded into the 20mm shell, and a stone is scraped across the hole on top to produce a spark to fire the weapon.

weapon.mod.extendedmags.name: かくちょうマガジン
weapon.mod.extendedmags.description: The Extended Magazine is an attachment which increases a gun's ammo capacity. If your gun has a free attachment slot, this may be useful.

flamethrower.name: フレイムスローワー
flamethrower.description:
The Flame Thrower (or flamethrower) is a close range weapon that also serves as a basic raiding tool. Fire sprayed from a flamethrower may obscure a target's vision and rapidly drain their health.

The Flame Thrower will start to steadily spawn fireballs once the trigger has been held long enough, and each one will damage and slow players or burn any wooden items they touch. Take care- fireballs spawned from spraying can and will burn bodies away (but their loot will fall in a bag if they do).

Raiding with a flamethrower is accomplished by continuously spraying a wooden structure with fire until it shatters. Structures without a base for the fireballs to land on are very inefficient to raid with a flamethrower, since fireballs will not damage the targeted area.

Many would not recommend using this as a weapon because of its low Damage Per Second, and short range. A good shotgun can outperform it in many situations.

grenade.flashbang.name: フラッシュバン
grenade.flashbang.description: A bright explosive device which blinds and disorients anyone near it upon detonation

weapon.mod.gascompressionovedrive.name: ガスコンプレッション・オーバードライブ
weapon.mod.gascompressionovedrive.description: An internal weapon mod which compresses and directs gasses used for cycling the weapon to the barrel, effectively increasing projectile velocity and damage at the expense of cycle rate.

hmlmg.name: HMLMG
hmlmg.description: A hand-made belt-fed light machine gun with high damage, high rate of fire, and low accuracy during bursts. This craftable weapon serves as a direct craft item of the infamous m249, not quite as easy to control, slightly lower damage and fire-rate but rest assured, this is a weapon that still packs enough kick to cause some real damage.

t1_smg.name: Tier1 SMG
t1_smg.description: An extremely basic automatic firearm. Low damage and accuracy.

weapon.mod.holosight.name: ホロサイト
weapon.mod.holosight.description: The Holosight is a craftable alternative to standard weapon iron sights. Its reticle is a bright red holographic bullseye which also glows in the dark, making it the best scope for night-time combat. Thanks to its slight magnification, it can provide a greater degree of accuracy to any ranged weapon without sacrificing recoil control or close-quarter capabilities. It's especially useful if barrel attachments obscure the weapon's original sights, such as the Silencer.

craftCost.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldrad.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldsafe.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

homingmissile.launcher.name: ホーミングミサイルランチャー
homingmissile.launcher.description: An active-guidance homing missile launcher. Once launched, the target must be tracked by the launcher until impact. Can be distracted by flares.

craftCost.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldrad.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldsafe.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

bow.hunting.name: 弓
bow.hunting.description:
An old school weapon for new school fun. Useful for short to medium range combat. Arrows shot have a chance to break when they hit, so be sure to carry more than one arrow.

Can use either regular Arrows or High-Velocity Arrows which are able to go farther faster, but do less damage. Best used to hunt animals and other humans.

rifle.l96.name: L96
rifle.l96.description: A military issue high powered rifle. Offers more accuracy at longer ranges than the Bolt Action at the tradeoff of being uncraftable. Obtained through APC and Locked crates.

rifle.lr300.name: LR-300アサルトライフル
rifle.lr300.description:
The LR-300 is a rare, military grade assault rifle. Dealing moderate-high damage combined with its low recoil and high ammo capacity render the LR-300 a weapon to be reckoned with. However, with its moderate rate of fire and relatively high spread, its use at long ranges may be of question.
It was previously considered to be one of the rarest weapons in the game, now much more readily available due to it's availability at the Bandit Camp's Black Market merchant.

longsword.name: ロング ソード
longsword.description: A very powerful melee weapon. Whilst slow, it delivers a great amount of melee damage with each swing or poke.

lmg.m249.name: M249
lmg.m249.description: The M249 Light Machine Gun can only be found in Helicopter Crates and Bradley Crates. It has a magazine capacity of 100 5.56 bullets, the largest in the game. It does more damage than the Assault Rifle and has a slightly faster rate of fire while being way easier to control recoil-wise, allowing for very accurate and deadly bursts in long-range when coupled with a Holographic sight or an 8x scope.

rifle.m39.name: M39
rifle.m39.description: The M39 Rifle is the uncraftable military-grade equivalent to the Semi-Auto Rifle. Offers a higher magazine capacity, higher damage, and better accuracy. Its downsides are its slightly lower rate of fire and its rarity. It can cover a wider range of roles thanks to the superior stats it has.

shotgun.m4.name: M4SG
shotgun.m4.description: A semi automatic military issue shotgun

pistol.m92.name: M92
pistol.m92.description: The M92 pistol is a powerful weapon with low recoil and high fire rate and damage. It can't be crafted by the player, rather it has to be found inside crates, or purchased from the Bandit Camp.

smg.mp5.name: MP5A4
smg.mp5.description:
The MP5A4 is a craftable, military-grade 30-round submachine gun. Dealing moderate to low damage with low recoil which makes it extremely effective at close range. However, the MP5A4 has one of the widest spreads in the game, limiting its use to short range. Although, like the LR300, this can be countered with a lasersight, making it viable for medium-range combat.

The MP5 is currently the only craftable military-grade weapon.

mace.name: メイス
mace.description: Costing a negligible amount more than the machete, the mace offers far greater damage per swing at the cost of far less damage per second.

machete.name: マチェーテ
machete.description: A quick and medium damaging melee weapon. Swings fast and hits hard, useful for one last quick hit when in a close range battle and out of ammo.

military flamethrower.name: ピュリファイアー
military flamethrower.description:
The Military Flame Thrower is a military grade weapon that can only found in Heavy Scientists as a loot, which means it can’t be craft by players.
It has maximum capacity of 150 low-grade fuel, and a high fire rate. It takes more damage and range, area of effect than the handmade Flame Thrower, let it possible to become a weapon to against your enemies in the base.
The Military Flame Thrower cause specific damage that ignores the player’s armor and defense, make constant value of damage.

minigun.name: ミニガン
minigun.description: A military issue belt-fed machine gun with that must be spun up to fire. Fires rapidly once spun up at the expense of movement speed.

multiplegrenadelauncher.name: グレネードランチャー
multiplegrenadelauncher.description: A 40MM six barrel, semi automatic grenade launcher. Explosive, Shotgun and Smoke 40mm grenades can all be loaded into the launcher.

weapon.mod.muzzleboost.name: マズルブースト
weapon.mod.muzzleboost.description: The Muzzle Boost increases the firing speed of weapons, though sacrificing some accuracy. Ideal for close-range combat with fully automatic firearms like the Assault Rifle or Custom SMG.

weapon.mod.muzzlebrake.name: マズルブレーキ
weapon.mod.muzzlebrake.description: The Muzzle Brake is a barrel attachment used to reduce recoil with the cost of weapon damage. It is very effective for recoils that is hard to control, like the Assault Rifle. However, the Muzzle Brake will drastically decrease the velocity of the bullets, giving you a disadvantage for long range battles. It is recommended with full-auto weapons or semi-auto weapons.

pistol.nailgun.name: ネイルガン
pistol.nailgun.description: A low powered low range early game weapon using nailgun nails as ammunition. The nailgun is easily accessible, very cheap and makes a good secondary weapon when in early game.

paddle.name: パドル
paddle.description: A versatile melee weapon that can also be used to paddle a kayak.

pitchfork.name: デーモンフォーク
pitchfork.description: A 3 pronged pitchfork. Extremely easy to hit targets with.

pistol.prototype17.name: Prototype 17
pistol.prototype17.description: A burst fire prototype pistol. Burst fire is toggleable by pressing M.

shotgun.pump.name: ポンプショットガン
shotgun.pump.description: The Pump Shotgun is a mid-tier, close ranged weapon. With a magazine size of 6 and relatively fast firing rate it is ideal for close quarters raiding and combat. Its effective range varies only slightly on the ammo that is being used, but can be increased by using Slugs instead of Buckshot or Hand Made Shells.

pistol.python.name: パイソン
pistol.python.description: The Python deals a great amount of damage per shot, but it has only 6 bullets in one magazine. It is pretty useful for shorter - medium distances. If combined with something like a Thompson, or even a Nailgun, the Python is pretty useful.

pistol.revolver.name: リボルバー
pistol.revolver.description:
The Revolver is cheap, prime for early game use. Although inaccurate, the Revolver's quick rate of fire allows it hold its own against players at most stages. Being a revolver, it has a low capacity of just 8 shots, but it's still an upgrade from its 1- and 2- shot alternatives.

Taking a Revolver to a fight against opponents with metal armor is quite risky, as such opponents will take many more shots than normal to take out (even more so considering the small capacity). It is best advised to only use the Revolver against opponents with similar armaments or as a sidearm to another weapon.

rocket.launcher.name: ロケットランチャー
rocket.launcher.description: The Rocket Launcher is a utility weapon which is primarily used for raiding and base defense. It fires a single rocket at a time and must be reloaded between uses. When loaded with regular Rockets, it can be utilized as an end-game raiding tool, capable of damaging multiple building parts at once. If loaded with Incendiary Rockets, the Rocket Launcher may be used as an area denial tool to spread fire to an area to prevent movement through it. Regular rockets or High Velocity Rockets may also be used as an efficient, but expensive, weapon to be used against players, as its high damage usually means an instant kill.

salvaged.cleaver.name: サルベージクリーバー
salvaged.cleaver.description:
A slow, but powerful melee weapon. This is decent for PVPing but it's main use comes at farming components.

The salvaged cleaver is one of the few melee weapons capable of destroying any barrel in a single hit. It is also fairly cheap, this makes it an ideal weapon to use when farming large amounts of barrels, especially if they are spread out.

salvaged.sword.name: サルベージソード
salvaged.sword.description: Usually considered as the 'best' melee weapon because of its ability to take out most targets with one blow to the head, the Salvaged Sword is a cheap and durable weapon that most keep as a backup plan in the event of a fight turning to close quarters.

pistol.semiauto.name: セミオートピストル
pistol.semiauto.description:
The semi-automatic pistol (commonly referred to as the 'P250' or 'P2') is a fast firing, medium damage weapon that has a moderate bullet velocity and steep damage drop-off.

It is an extremely popular weapon due to it's effectiveness at short-medium distances and it's low cost. It can be easily used as a primary weapon or as a compliment to pretty much any other gun.

rifle.semiauto.name: セミオートライフル
rifle.semiauto.description: The Semi-Automatic Rifle is a staple of low quality weapons due to its high cost-efficiency. With its medium-tier damage, comparatively low recoil and high accuracy, the Semi-Automatic Rifle is the jack of all trades, but master of none.

weapon.mod.silencer.name: サイレンサー
weapon.mod.silencer.description: The Silencer is a barrel attachment known to reduce gunfire sounds. It also removes the muzzle flash, giving you a good advantage during night without being spotted. It is quite useful against unaware enemies, and can allow you to get in extra hits before being spotted. Although the disadvantages can make short range battles go wrong. It is a good option for Bolt Action Rifles and L96s as the Silencer completely hides the bullet tracers, making the enemies confused where it came from, though it will reduce the velocity of the gun, meaning that you will need to aim a bit higher than usual to hit your opponent.

weapon.mod.simplesight.name: シンプルサイト
weapon.mod.simplesight.description: The Simple Handmade Sight is a makeshift alternative to a weapon's iron sights. Its reticle is simply a single post that comes to a sharp point - not too dissimilar from the German #1 reticle. This scope is particularly useful for close engagements as it provides the widest field of view out of all the scopes, but it is usually not practical at longer distances due to its negative magnification making distant targets appear smaller. Alternatively, it can be used when the weapon's iron sights are obscured by barrel attachments such as the Silencer or by the lighting caused by Fire Arrows.

knife.skinning.name: スキニングナイフ
knife.skinning.description: A sharp skinning knife. Extremely good at harvesting flesh and can produce trophies that can be mounted on Hunting Trophies.

snowballgun.name: スノーボールランチャー
snowballgun.description: Load snowballs and lay waste to your foes with Christmas cheer.

shotgun.spas12.name: SPAS-12
shotgun.spas12.description: Semi Automatic shotgun that fires much faster than the craftable Pump shotgun, losing to it in base damage. Houses 3 attachment slots and has an internal ammo capacity of 6 shots. Able to use any kind of shotgun ammo, including handmade shells. It is a rare military grade weapon, dropped rarely by the Military Tunnel Scientists and found only inside crates, spawned from in-game events as rewards for destroying the Bradley APC and the Patrol Helicopter. Can be rarely found inside a Supply Drop.

speargun.name: スピアーガン
speargun.description: A speargun which can only be fired underwater. Excellent for hunting Sharks.

spear.stone.name: 石ヤリ
spear.stone.description:
The Stone Spear is slightly more durable and does more damage than the Wooden Spear.

The Stone Spear will cause critical bleeding (high percentage bleeding).

The Stone Spear, like the Wooden Spear, is throwable. After being thrown it will become stuck in the place it had hit (even in the target). You can pick it up by pressing the Use button (default 'E').

smg.thompson.name: トンプソン
smg.thompson.description:
The Thompson provides a mid-range alternative to other submachine guns while still offering close-range firepower. Its high accuracy and damage allow the user to take targets further away than other SMGs.

With the recent QoL update, the Thompson can now take underbarrel attachments, such as the Flashlight and Laser, marginally buffing it in comparison to the other SMGs.

vampire.stake.name: ヴァンパイアステーク
vampire.stake.description: A stake adorned with special properties making it able to release the soul of undead creatures with a single strike, as well as yield extra loot from their remains.

weapon.mod.8x.scope.name: バリアブルズームスコープ
weapon.mod.8x.scope.description: The 16x Zoom Scope is a military-grade telescopic sight. Its reticle is a thin cross with bullet-drop guides. Its extreme magnification allows for precise fire over extreme distances, but its narrow field of view makes it impractical for any close quarter engagements or full-auto fire. As it's susceptible to shaking, consider using a Weapon Lasersight or Tactical Gloves in addition to this scope.

gun.water.name: ウォーター ガン
gun.water.description: A large water gun with pumpable pressure. Hold reload to pump!

pistol.water.name: ウォーターピストル
pistol.water.description: A small water gun that doesn't require pumping, but has a lower range and output.

shotgun.waterpipe.name: ウォーターパイプショットガン
shotgun.waterpipe.description: The Waterpipe Shotgun is a low-tier gun that deals a decent amount of damage from close range. Can be loaded with the 12 Gauge Slug to deal less damage but shoot further. It is an early game weapon of choice for many and is often paired with a bow.

weapon.mod.lasersight.name: レーザー
weapon.mod.lasersight.description: The Weapon Lasersight serves as a welcome attachment to any weapon, with its only hindrance being the rarity of tech trash, and the possibility of a player tracing the laser back to its user. The reduced hip spread and aim sway makes it useful for weapons at close and distant ranges alike.

craftCost.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldrad.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldsafe.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

weapon.mod.flashlight.name: ウェポンフラッシュライト
weapon.mod.flashlight.description: The Flashlight is a weapon attachment, able to be attached to eligible weapons. To use it, the user presses their attachment function key (default F), and a bright cone of light will emit from underneath the barrel of their weapon. Light is useful for being able to see in the dark or blinding other players if close enough.

spear.wooden.name: 木のヤリ
spear.wooden.description:
The Wooden Spear will inflict damage and cause the 'Bleeding' effect on the target.

The Wooden Spear is throwable. After being thrown it will become stuck in the place it had hit (in the target). You can pick it up by pressing the 'Use' button (default 'E').

Can be upgraded to Stone Spear.

door.hinged.toptier.name: 装甲板ドア
door.hinged.toptier.description: The Armored Door is the highest tier door and is the best option for base defense. If the door is put on a weaker door frame, the door frame will be targeted instead of the door itself. The door has a working hatch which allows you to see outside of the door and can be shot through in both directions.

door.double.hinged.toptier.name: 装甲板のダブルドア
door.double.hinged.toptier.description: The armored double door is the highest tier double door and is the best for base defense. Because of its high durability, if the door is placed in a weak wall frame, raiders may target the wall frame instead of the door itself. The door has working hatches and these hatches allow you to see outside of the door and can be shot through in both directions.

barricade.woodwire.name: ゆうしてっせんの木バリケード
barricade.woodwire.description:
The barbed wooden barricade is the second tier of barricades that will damage other players. It can be placed on foundations, and floors.

They deal more damage than the wooden barricades but less then the metal barricade. Also you can get the bleeding effect when you touch them. Trying deal damage with melee attacks will damage you as if you ran into them.

building.planner.name: ビルディングプラン
building.planner.description:
The Building Plan is used to create weak twig structures at the cost of a nominal amount of wood. These twigs may be upgraded with a Hammer if the player has the resources to do so.

Players may not build in zones in which there is a tool cupboard that they are not authorized on. Additionally, players may not build in certain areas of the map (such as near a radtown). Otherwise, players may build anywhere of their choosing.

wall.frame.fence.name: チェーンフェンス
wall.frame.fence.description: The chainlink fence is a fence that can be placed in a building frame. It can be used in a base as an extra barrier. Players and turrets are able to shoot through the fence.

wall.frame.fence.gate.name: チェーンフェンス・ゲート
wall.frame.fence.gate.description: The chainlink fence gate is used as a door and is usually used in conjunction with the chainlink fence. It can be used as an extra layer of base security if needed. It is placed in a building frame. Player and turrets are able to shoot through the fence gate and kill players on the other side.

lock.code.name: コード ロック
lock.code.description:
The code lock is used to lock doors, hatches, and storage crates. Players may set a new four-digit PIN if the lock is unlocked. Once locked, an LED on the keypad will change to red, indicating its status.

Other players may attempt to gain access to a locked item by typing in a PIN in the keypad. If they are correct, a short beep will emit from the lock, and the player will subsequently have permanent access to the locked item (assuming the code isn't changed). If the player guesses incorrectly, a failure beep will play alongside an electric arc animation on the keypad, and the player will take increasing increments of damage until they wait long enough or die.

Guest codes may be set on unlocked locks (make sure it's locked after setting the code!), which allows other players access to the locked item without the ability to unlock, remove, or change the code.

Unlocked Code Locks may be removed or have a new password set by any player.

barricade.concrete.name: コンクリートバリケード
barricade.concrete.description:
The Concrete Barricade is a deployable building component. It is the most costly and strongest of barricades. They are as about the width of a foundation and slightly higher than a crouching player.

Due to its low height, barricades are usually placed on higher ground than the opponent. Examples of usage include the top of a hill, roofs and towers. High External Walls take their intended use during combat.

door.closer.name: ドアクローザー
door.closer.description: Automatically closes doors for you after a short duration, so that you don't have to manually close the door every time. It can be spawned by admins with sufficient privileges via console. Normal players will not be able to get it via barrels nor crates.

floor.grill.name: フロアグリル
floor.grill.description: A Floor Grill is a building component able to be placed in floor frames. Floor Grills are able to be seen, but not shot, through. They are useful for allowing players to see if others are in a room or in front of the entrance to their base. Floor Grills offer less health, and invariably protection, than sheet metal (or arguably stone) floors. It is recommended to upgrade the floor frame in which the Floor Grill is placed to at least stone so that it will not prove to be a liability for the base.

floor.triangle.grill.name: 三角のフロアグリル
floor.triangle.grill.description: A floor grill must be placed in floor frames. Perfect for placing above a large furnace.

wall.frame.garagedoor.name: ガレージ
wall.frame.garagedoor.description: The garage door is a form of lockable door which slides upward from the bottom when opened. It fits within a wall frame, like the double door, but opens much slower than any other type of door. It is, however, more durable than the sheet metal double door - making it an effective loot room door.

gates.external.high.stone.name: 石壁ゲート
gates.external.high.stone.description: The High External Stone Gate is used with High External Stone Walls as a door for a player's compound.

wall.external.high.stone.name: 石壁
wall.external.high.stone.description: High External Stone Walls are generally used in the construction of compounds, and, unlike their wooden relatives, are fire-resistant and require explosives to get through unless you use a ladder, though this may prove difficult due to the damage and slow inflicted by the barbed wire on top of these walls.

gates.external.high.wood.name: 木壁ゲート
gates.external.high.wood.description:
The High External Wooden Gate is a deployable building object used in conjunction with High External Wooden Walls to deny access to an area. The high external gate entrance is about the height and width of a standard 2x2 wall. While its total width is approximately 2.5 foundations wide.

The wall model comes with barbed wire but does not slow down or damage any players like its wall counterpart.

wall.external.high.name: 木壁
wall.external.high.description:
The High External Wooden Wall is a deployable building object used to wall off an area. The high external is about the height and width of a standard 2x2 wall. The wall also comes with a barbed wire top slowing down and damaging any players that come into contact with it.

High externals can be a cheap and effective way to deny entry, however they decay fairly quickly and need to be maintained.

Due to their size High External Walls are often used in combat as deployable cover.

wall.external.high.ice.name: アイス・ウォール
wall.external.high.ice.description: A very high ice wall to protect your property.

lock.key.name: キーロック
lock.key.description:
Key locks are used to lock doors, hatches, storage boxes and tool cupboards. Once placed it should be locked by activating it and selecting "Lock." For players other than the one who placed it to unlock it, they must have a key created by by the originating player.

To remove a lock, unlock it and pick it up.

floor.ladder.hatch.name: ハッチ
floor.ladder.hatch.description: Building element for the vertical connection between two floors. Fits into a floor frame.

water.catcher.large.name: 大型ウォーターキャッチャー
water.catcher.large.description: The Large Water Catcher is a large deployable that collects water passively. This water can be used to re-hydrate players and water crops. The large water catcher is capable of holding up to 50,000 ml of water.

legacy.shelter.wood.name: ウッドシェルター
legacy.shelter.wood.description: The classic s*** shack. A great starter base for any fresh spawn. There is a limit to how many you can place.

barricade.metal.name: 金属バリケード
barricade.metal.description: The Metal Barricade will damage any player that touches it and is often used as part of base defense. Its high amount of health relative to other barricades makes it an especially good tool for denying areas, as often explosives must be used to remove it.

wall.frame.shopfront.metal.name: メタルショップフロント
wall.frame.shopfront.metal.description:
The metal shop front is quite useful for trading. The vendor can stand safely behind it without worrying about getting shot, as the glass is bulletproof. When the player on the inside and the player on the outside have put in items to make the desired trade, they both have to accept the deal for the items to be transferred.

As the Metal Shop Front has similar durability to a sheet metal wall, along with bulletproof glass, it can be used as a safe window to spy on neighbors at higher levels of a base.

shutter.metal.embrasure.b.name: 垂直ガンシャッター
shutter.metal.embrasure.b.description: Placed over a window it is used to reduce the size and grants the player more cover than the window. It is the counterpart to the Metal Horizontal Embrasure providing more protection and the player's reducing vision from the left and right sides of the window.

wall.window.bars.metal.name: 金属のウィンドウバー
wall.window.bars.metal.description: The Metal Window Bars are the mid-tier window bars, provide little cover and deny entrance through windows. They are stronger than their wooden counterpart.

shutter.metal.embrasure.a.name: 水平ガンシャッター
shutter.metal.embrasure.a.description: Placed over a window it is used to reduce the size and grants the player more cover than the window. It is the counterpart to the Metal Vertical Embrasure providing more protection and the player's reducing vision from above and below the window.

mining.quarry.name: マイニング
mining.quarry.description:
The Mining Quarry is a machine that requires diesel fuel to run in exchange for stones, sulfur or high quality metal.

The Mining Quarry is always prioritized to spawn in Procedural Maps, Stone Quarry spawns in Temperate, Sulfur Quarry spawns in Desert and High Quality Metal Quarry spawns in Snow (although the seed might glitch and have them in the wrong biomes).

The Mining Quarry cannot be locked to a player. However, you can build High External Walls around the Mining Quarry and use auto turrets to stop players from entering the Mining Quarry and stealing your resources.

As of December 2017, mining quarry is no longer craftable or available as a loot drop. It is only obtainable by admins.

To place the Mining Quarry, you require Survey Charges. Find a biome that is common in the resources you want to mine. Throw them on a suitable spot (preferably flat ground). If any of the resources (stones, sulfur, high quality metal or crude oil) pops out from the explosion, it means the spot will have the resource for the Mining Quarry to mine (sometimes can be stones with sulfur or high quality metal). Turn 360 degrees to check if the Mining Quarry can be placed. If placed, put diesel fuel inside the blue barrels located at the side of the Mining Quarry and climb to the top and start the engine.

wall.frame.netting.name: ネット
wall.frame.netting.description: A placeable object which provides a climbable surface.

wall.frame.cell.gate.name: プリズンゲート
wall.frame.cell.gate.description:
The prison cell gate is a door that fits into a wall frame.

It is unique in that autoturrets and flame turrets can shoot through it.
It opens by sliding to the side, leaving the other side accessible.

It is worth noting that chests can be accessed through a
cell gate, so it is not suited for loot rooms.

wall.frame.cell.name: プリズンフレーム
wall.frame.cell.description: A prison cell wall. Cannot be picked up after placed.

mining.pumpjack.name: ポンプジャック
mining.pumpjack.description: The Pump Jack is currently a non-craftable item. Its original intended purpose was to allow players to harvest Crude Oil and Low Grade Fuel similar to the Quarry. It can only be found on the map near the Power Plant, Train Yard, and Water Treatment monuments. Pump Jacks can be loaded with Diesel Fuel.

wall.window.bars.toptier.name: 装甲板ウィンドウガラス
wall.window.bars.toptier.description: The Reinforced Glass Window is now the highest-tier glass window. It replaced the Strengthened glass Window's spot for the highest HP window, and you are now unable to shoot through it. This makes it vital for loot rooms and external TCs. Not very useful for information gathering, as the viewing area is quite small and obstructed by thick bars.

barricade.sandbags.name: 土のうバリケード
barricade.sandbags.description:
The Sandbag Barricade is a deployable building component. It is the most cost effective of barricades. They are as about the width of a foundation and slightly higher than a crouching player.

Due to its low height, barricades are usually placed on higher ground than the opponent. Examples of usage include the top of a hill, roofs and towers. High External Walls take their intended use during combat.

door.hinged.metal.name: 板金ドア
door.hinged.metal.description: The Sheet Metal Door is the most common door found on bases due to its resistances to melee weapons and fire but relatively cheap cost to craft. Regardless, it is still relatively weak to explosives compared to its expensive indirect upgrade, the 'Armoured Door'.

door.double.hinged.metal.name: 板金のダブルドア
door.double.hinged.metal.description: It has the same health as a sheet metal door. It requires double the materials, but allows for more space within your base. Ideal for loot rooms and other cramped areas.

wall.frame.shopfront.name: ショップフロント
wall.frame.shopfront.description: A shop front to do commerce.

wall.ice.wall.name: 低いアイスウォール
wall.ice.wall.description: A short wall made of solid ice.

water.catcher.small.name: 小さなウォーターキャッチャー
water.catcher.small.description:
The Small Water Catcher is a deployable that collects water passively. It's useful to keep a solo player or small group hydrated without having to leave their base. The catcher is capable of holding 10,000 ml of water.

Catchers receive collection bonuses during weather events such as rain, snow, and fog.

barricade.stone.name: 石バリケード
barricade.stone.description:
The Stone Barricade is a deployable building component. It is the cheapest, weakest and smallest of barricades. They are slightly less than the width of a foundation and slightly higher than a crouching player.

Due to its low height, barricades are usually placed on higher ground than the opponent. Examples of usage include the top of a hill, roofs and towers. High External Walls take their intended use during combat.

wall.window.glass.reinforced.name: ガラスウィンドウ
wall.window.glass.reinforced.description: Bulleproof window glass, can block any incoming bullet projectile. Cannot block explosives.

cupboard.tool.name: 工具棚（TC）
cupboard.tool.description:
The Tool Cupboard is essential for any base because it prevents people who are not authorized from upgrading building blocks and placing and picking up deployables within a 25-meter radius (around 9 foundation blocks) from the cupboard. If you press 'E' on the cupboard you can authorize yourself so you are able to build in this area. If you hold 'E' on the cupboard you can clear the list of players authorized including yourself. Any player authorized from the cupboard will not be targeted by any flame turrets or shotgun traps within the cupboard's radius.

Tool Cupboards can be locked with Key and Code Locks in order to disallow players from authorizing themselves without a passcode.

floor.triangle.ladder.hatch.name: 三角のハッチ
floor.triangle.ladder.hatch.description: A hatch that opens and changes into a ladder.

watchtower.wood.name: アーチャータワー
watchtower.wood.description:
A place-able tower that can be used to help hold positions.
Cannot be placed on foundations
Relatively resistant to gunfire, but falls reasonably fast to melee weapons or weapon throws.

door.double.hinged.wood.name: 木のダブルドア
door.double.hinged.wood.description:
A Cheap door to secure your base. Its vulnerability to fire and weak explosive resistance makes the door a temporary solution to securing your base. Due to its flaws you should look at upgrading to a higher tier door such as Sheet Metal.

The Wooden Door can take two kinds of locks the basic Key Lock and the Code Lock. To pick up the door, remove any locks and open, hold down the E (USE) key and select 'Pickup'.

shutter.wood.a.name: ウッドシャッター
shutter.wood.a.description:
Wooden Shutters are deployable items that can only be placed on windows. They provide the ability to selectively allow or disallow the open state of the window they are placed on which can be used to deny outside players from firing bullets inside the building. In addition, these shutters cannot be locked, allowing either players from inside or outside to open and close them freely so long as they are within reach.


As a result, window shutters are usually used on a high floor of a building, which only allows players from the inside to have easy access to them. It should be noted that placing window shutters will grant raiders the ability to know which windows you are actively using to shoot them from if you are closing them after you are done using them.

barricade.wood.name: 木のバリケード
barricade.wood.description: The Wooden Barricade will damage any player that touches it and is often used as part of base defense.

barricade.wood.cover.name: 木のバリケードカバー
barricade.wood.cover.description: Perfect for cover when engaging in gun fights. Decays rapidly when placed outside of building privilege.

door.hinged.wood.name: 木ドア
door.hinged.wood.description:
The Wooden Door is an early game building item that is made from wood and cheap to produce. Being the cheapest of all the doors, it is often used alongside a Lock to quickly secure a base. Its vulnerability to fire and weak explosive resistance makes the door a temporary solution to securing your base. Due to its flaws it should quickly be upgraded to a higher tier door such as Sheet Metal.

The Wooden Door can take two kinds of locks the basic Lock and the Code Lock. To pick up the door, remove any locks, hold down the E (USE) key and select 'Pickup'. Note: There is currently a bug where a door sometimes can not be picked up until any type of Lock has been placed and removed.

door.double.hinged.bardoors.name: フロンティアバーのドア
door.double.hinged.bardoors.description: Hand-carved, rugged bar doors embody the spirit of the frontier. A must-have for any survivor.

ladder.wooden.wall.name: ハシゴ
ladder.wooden.wall.description: A ladder will help you climb walls in any base.

wall.window.bars.wood.name: 木のウィンドウバー
wall.window.bars.wood.description: The Wooden Window Bars are the lowest-tier window bars, provide little cover and deny entrance through windows. They are weaker over its reinforced and metal counterparts. Due to its weakness to fire damage and low health higher tier window bars are recommended.

xmas.advent.name: アドベントカレンダー
xmas.advent.description: Receive a special gift each and every day!

bbq.name: バーベキューグリル
bbq.description: The Barbeque acts as a larger, permanent campfire. It's capable of cooking a large amount of food at the same time. The lid opens when the Barbeque is ignited, but otherwise remains closed.

bathtub.planter.name: バスタブのプランター
bathtub.planter.description: A small planter with enough room to plant 3 seeds.

bed.name: ベッド
bed.description:
The bed can be used as a spawn point, just like the sleeping bag, but it has reduced cooldown use; instead of waiting 5 minutes like the Sleeping Bag, you just wait 2 minutes.

You should have a bed if your base is upgraded and quite decent, because if you are getting raided and you have to respawn to defend your base, you cannot afford 5 minutes of respawn delay.

botabag.name: 革バッグ
botabag.description:
The Bota Bag is a handmade pouch for the collection and transportation of drinkable water.

To fill, equip it and right click while looking at a source of water. You can then drink from it whenever you desire with a left click (make sure the water in the pouch is freshwater and not salt/stagnant water).

If the water in the pouch is not desired, or if you are attempting to extinguish a fire (not napalm), you can right click on the pouch again to dump it's contents.

campfire.name: キャンプファイヤー
campfire.description: A basic survival tool - used to cook food, smelt tin cans, keep warm, provide comfort to players, and light up dark areas.

carvable.pumpkin.name: カーバブルパンプキン
carvable.pumpkin.description:
A pumpkin that you can carve.

Requires wood as a fuel source.

chair.name: チェア
chair.description: The chair is normally made for decorative purpose. But you can mount it to receive 100% comfort. Hover over it and press the E key to mount it and press the space bar to dismount it.

chineselanternwhite.name: チャイニーズランタン・ホワイト

arcade.machine.chippy.name: Chippy  Arcade ゲーム
arcade.machine.chippy.description:
A craftable arcade machine that can play games.

Currently it can play 1 game that is a contribution of another one of facepunches games known as 'Chippy'

You play through a retro style of the game while getting a highscore.

xmasdoorwreath.name: クリスマスドアリース
xmasdoorwreath.description: Get into the christmas spirit with this holiday door wreath.

xmas.lightstring.name: クリスマスライト
xmas.lightstring.description: A string of colored lights to decorate your home.

xmas.tree.name: クリスマスツリー
xmas.tree.description: The Christmas Tree is a festive item that can be placed on most horizontal surfaces. Many things can be placed onto it to make it look better, such as; decorative baubles, Decorative Gingerbread Men, Decorative Pinecones, Decorative Plastic Candy Canes, Decorative Tinsel, Star Tree Topper and Tree Lights.

skidoo.name: ダイビングスクーター

craftCost.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldrad.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldsafe.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

sign.post.double.name: 2方向の看板
sign.post.double.description: A double sign post that you can plant into terrain.

dragondoorknocker.name: ドラゴンドアノッカー

drone.name: ドローン
drone.description: A remote controlled drone operated from the Computer station with a limited range. Easily damaged from impacts.

dropbox.name: ドロップボックス
dropbox.description:
The drop box is a device mountable on any wall so long as there is nothing else on that wall such as lamps or another drop box. The front of the drop box is typically placed on the exterior of a building, so that items may be deposited safely to anyone on the other side.

The drop box does not require the operation of more than one person, but it will fill up if someone on the rear end does not empty it from time to time, which will disallow you from depositing more items. Be careful to make sure the correct side is facing you when you deploy it, as it may be annoying to remove and place again if you make a mistake.

easterdoorwreath.name: イースターのドアリース
easterdoorwreath.description: A beautiful, hand crafted Easter themed door wreath.

xmas.door.garland.name: お祝いのダブルドアウェイガーランド
xmas.door.garland.description: A Festive decoration to spruce up your doorway during the holidays!

xmas.double.door.garland.name: ダブルドアウェイのフェスガーランド
xmas.double.door.garland.description: A Festive decoration to spruce up your double doorway during the holidays!

xmas.window.garland.name: まどのクリスマスリース
xmas.window.garland.description: A Festive decoration to spruce up your windows during the holidays!

fishtrophy.name: フィッシュトロフィー
fishtrophy.description: A wall mountable item to show off your greatest catches. Fish not included.

frankensteintable.name: フランケンシュタインテーブル
frankensteintable.description: The Frankenstein Table is a halloween exclusive item released in 2021's Halloween Event. By placing in a Frankenstein Head, Frankenstein Torso and Frankenstein Legs, you will create your own pet. Flipping the switch of the Frankenstein Table awakens the pet, you can then order it to assist, attack, follow, stand and more actions.

fridge.name: 冷ぞうこ
fridge.description: Item used for storing various types of food and drink. Currently serves no use however it is speculated food will eventually spoil if left out in chests, furnaces, or boxes in the updates to come.

gunrack.single.1.horizontal.name: フロンティアボルト・シングルラック
gunrack.single.1.horizontal.description: Artfully display your weapon with a handcrafted wall-mounted single weapon rack.

gunrack.single.3.horizontal.name: フロンティアホースシュー・シングルラック
gunrack.single.3.horizontal.description: Artfully display your weapon with a handcrafted wall-mounted single weapon rack.

gunrack.single.2.horizontal.name: フロンティアホーン・シングルラック
gunrack.single.2.horizontal.description: Artfully display your weapon with a handcrafted wall-mounted single weapon rack.

furnace.name: 小さなかまど
furnace.description: The furnace is the cheapest item for smelting metal and sulfur ore.

hazmat.plushy.name: ハズマットくん
hazmat.plushy.description: A plushy of your favourite outfit made by the fabulous people at YouTooz.com

heavyscientistyoutooz.name: ヘビーサイエンティスト ユートゥーズ

hitchtroughcombo.name: ヒッチトラフ
hitchtroughcombo.description: A Hitching post and Trough. Dismounting your horses here will keep them healthy and fed as long as it is kept stocked with food.

hobobarrel.name: 錆びたドラム缶
hobobarrel.description:
Hobo Barrel is a large campfire that can be seen in certain monuments. It functions just like campfires and require wood as fuel, you can also cook food on it. It cannot be destroyed or picked up. Standing near a burning hobo barrel gives comfort. Because of the invincibility it has, admins are most likely to spawn hobo barrels to block off places that players are not supposed to reach (out of bounds, places glitching out, etc..)

It was once obtainable during the January 2021 Twitch Drop, it is now unobtainable and only admins or players that own the hobo barrels can place it.

gunrack.horizontal.name: ローウェポンラック
gunrack.horizontal.description: Artfully display your arsenal with a handcrafted wall-mounted weapon rack.

sign.wooden.huge.name: 巨大な看板
sign.wooden.huge.description: This is the largest sign available. You can paint on this sign using the in-game editor. Signs are useful for indicating shop prices and more.

sculpture.ice.name: アイススカルプチャー
sculpture.ice.description: An block of ice you can sculpt.

jackolantern.angry.name: アングリージャック・オー・ランタン
jackolantern.angry.description: A Lantern. Place it where you need light.

jackolantern.happy.name: ハッピージャック・オー・ランタン
jackolantern.happy.description: A Lantern. Place it where you need light.

kayak.name: カヤック
kayak.description: An improvised wooden kayak. Seats two and requires a Paddle to operate.

photoframe.landscape.name: 横ながフォトフレーム
photoframe.landscape.description: A landscape oriented canvas for artists paintings.

sign.pictureframe.landscape.name: 横ながフォトフレーム
sign.pictureframe.landscape.description: A landscape oriented canvas for artists paintings.

lantern.name: ランプ
lantern.description:
A Lantern. Place it where you need light, requires low grade fuel to work.

Can be placed on the ground deployables. Consumes 1 low grade fuel per 10 minutes.

sign.hanging.banner.large.name: たれまく（大）
sign.hanging.banner.large.description: A large banner hanging on a wall.

sign.pole.banner.large.name: ポールの大きなバナー
sign.pole.banner.large.description: Offers basic drawing features. Same as all the other items you can draw on but only this one is standing so you can place it on foundations, rocks and other places to show off just how good Monet you are.

furnace.large.name: 大きなかまど
furnace.large.description:
The Large Furnace is used for smelting larger quantities of ore, faster than a regular furnace.
The ores that can be smelted using a Large Furnace are: Metal Ore, Sulfur Ore and High Quality Metal Ore.
Wood is used as the fuel for smelting and the Large Furnace holds 2 stacks of wood for up to 2000 total.
There are 5 slots for raw materials so a total of 5000 ore can be smelted at once.
There are 5 output slots which will fill with your finished product and charcoal.

The Large Furnace must be placed on terrain and takes up 4 square foundations space.
The Large Furnace cannot be placed on foundations or floors.

huntingtrophylarge.name: ラージハンティングトロフィー
huntingtrophylarge.description: A large trophy stand to mount the head of killed animals or enemies.

photoframe.large.name: 大きいフォトフレーム
photoframe.large.description: A large frame for your photos.

planter.large.name: プランター（大）
planter.large.description:
Large planters are a planter variant that fits nicely in a 1x1 floor/foundation. It can hold a maximum of 9 separate plants, including corn, hemp, and pumpkin.

Seeds placed in a planter grow 2x as fast as they would normally on wild ground. Being exposed to light (be it natural sunlight or artificial ceiling lamps) further increases the growth time to 4x the normal speed. Planters also grant you the ability to water the plants, which significantly increases their yield when harvested. A fully matured hemp plant produces 10 cloth normally, but can produce up to 40 cloth when watered properly.

To fill your planter with water, simply fill a bucket and dump it straight onto your planter. The maximum amount of water a large planter can hold at once is exactly 9000 ml, and once plants are planted they will soak up an initial amount of water, so it will drain the water fast initially. You may need to refill the planter several times if using many plants at the same time.

box.wooden.large.name: 大きい木箱
box.wooden.large.description:
A Large Wood Box is your most popular and conventional way to store your belongings. Each box has enough storage for 48x separate items/stacks of items.

They can have both locks and code locks placed on them to keep unwanted players at bay for a brief period. If destroyed, they will destroy a portion of their contents as well.

Boxes can be placed on shelves to save space.

sign.wooden.large.name: 大きな木の看板
sign.wooden.large.description: This is the middle ground of sign sizes. You can paint on the sign using the in-game editor. Signs are useful for indicating shop prices and more.

locker.name: ロッカー
locker.description: The locker allows you to quickly remove items off your player into the locker. Pressing the "Swap" button inside the locker will remove all 7 clothing slots and all 6 active items. You can have three different sets of clothing/gear in the locker.

mailbox.name: メール ボックス
mailbox.description:
The mail box can be placed just about anywhere and have a special compartment that can only accept notes and cassettes.

Players without building privileges will only be shown one slot for the note or cassette they are about to leave. Players with building privileges can open it to gain access to any items left inside.

When an item is left then the small red flag on the side of the mail box is raised to indicate at a glance that something is inside. Once the mail box is accessed by a player with building privileges then the red flag will lower, regardless of whether the mail box is emptied or not.

sign.wooden.medium.name: 中ぐらいの木の看板
sign.wooden.medium.description: A 2-meter by 1-meter wooden sign that you can write on.

minecart.planter.name: マインカートプランター
minecart.planter.description: A small planter with enough room to plant 2 seeds.

mixingtable.name: ミキシング テーブル

sign.post.town.name: ナワバリのひょうしき（片面）
sign.post.town.description: A one sided town sign post, that you can plant into terrain.

map.name: ペーパーマップ
map.description:
The Paper Map is one of the first things you should consider crafting when joining a new world. Costing only 5 wood it displays the entire island you have to explore.

To open the map, you must place it in your hotbar and then hold the G key on your keyboard. On this map you will see your marker and direction you are facing, the island's topography, biomes, points of interest, and even vending machine locations/names which can help new players substantially.

This item is no longer available to craft.

pookie.bear.name: クマたん
pookie.bear.description:
The pookie bear is probably your best friend during holiday season. Not only will it not betray you, it will also cheer you whenever you want him too!

When you are near him 100% comfort effect is being applied to you, thus allowing you to slowly heal to 100HP when your hunger is above 100 points, and you are not dying from dehydration or bleeding.

photoframe.portrait.name: ポートレートのフォトフレーム
photoframe.portrait.description: A portrait oriented canvas for artists paintings.

sign.pictureframe.portrait.name: がくぶち(縦なが)
sign.pictureframe.portrait.description: A portrait oriented canvas for artists paintings.

rail.road.planter.name: レールロードプランター
rail.road.planter.description: A large planter with enough room to plant 9 seeds.

box.repair.bench.name: リペアベンチ
box.repair.bench.description:
Repair benches offer a cost-effective way to repair once-broken items back to a usable state. Each repair costs half of the original cost of a new version of the item, and does not use components. Every time an item is repaired, it loses some of it's maximum durability. This is represented with a red portion on the durability bar of the item.

The Repair Bench can currently change the skin of any item you have (granted it HAS varying skins) to any skin that you own in your steam inventory.

research.table.name: リサーチ テーブル
research.table.description: The research table is a craftable deployable item that is used for researching obtained items for scrap. This can be done by USING the research table, inserting your item, and inserting the amount of scrap to learn the item's blueprint in an appropriate workbench. (note: blueprint is guaranteed unlike previous versions of rust).

rockingchair.name: ノーマルロッキングチェア
rockingchair.description: A rocking chair that responds to your input. Don't fire whilst seated.

rug.name: ラグ
rug.description: The rug is found in Barrel around the rust island and provides comfort while near it. Comfort is a beneficial effect that is applied whenever the player is close to comfortable items. While under its effect, the player regenerates health (more quickly), Hunger is depleted significantly faster and Radiation Poisoning has less effect. The amount of comfort is determined by the Comfort providing item and the amount of players nearby.

rug.bear.name: クマのラグマット
rug.bear.description: Bear Rug skin that can be placed on most walls, floors, and ceilings. Note: If placed on a ceiling, standing directly below its head/neck will provide 100% comfort, even when alone.

stocking.large.name: スーパー ストッキング
stocking.large.description:
A special christmas-styled 'container' that generates various goodies after 2 to 3 in-game nights. It must be placed on a player-made structure in order for it to generate items. Quite useful, but you can't depend on it too much due to its RNG nature, thus making it more useful as a small supplement to your resources.

When an item has spawned inside it, the top of the Stocking shall glow bright yellow and have tiny stars flow out on the sides.

Limited availability. Acquired through upgrading Regular Stockings, which are found in special Christmas presents, spawning only during the Christmas time of the year obviously.

shelves.name: 金属の棚
shelves.description: Metal shelves often used for storage of wooden boxes, as well as a possible decoration of your home.

scarecrow.name: カカシ
scarecrow.description:
The Scarecrow item was added as a unique item store purchase during the 2017 Halloween event alongside other unique skins and items.

The Scarecrow has no use in-game but can be placed down on the terrain.

secretlabchair.name: シークレットラボ チェア
secretlabchair.description: A luxurious, comfortable chair for long sessions of CCTV watching.

sign.post.single.name: 方向指示のひょうしき（1方向）
sign.post.single.description: A single sign post that you can plant into terrain.

skulldoorknocker.name: スカルのドアノッカー

sleepingbag.name: 寝袋
sleepingbag.description:
A sleeping bag is a critical part of playing Rust. When placed, this item offers a respawn point directly on top of it. It can be named, given to a friend, or even be picked up by it's owner by using the interact key on it.

After death, a menu will appear displaying your sleeping bags and beds by name and you can select whichever one you need. After being used, or being placed, there is a 5-minute cooldown period before being able to spawn on it.

When possible, you should upgrade your base's respawn point to a bed, which has a drastically shorter cooldown timer.

huntingtrophysmall.name: スモールハンティングトロフィー
huntingtrophysmall.description: A trophy stand to mount the head of killed animals or enemies.

small.oil.refinery.name: せい油所
small.oil.refinery.description:
The Small Oil Refinery is used to refine low grade fuel from crude oil. Each crude oil produces 3 low grade fuel. The cost of the refinery is quite expensive but can prove to be worth its cost in the long run.

Note: As of January 18 2018, the Small Oil Refinery produces charcoal.

planter.small.name: プランター（小）
planter.small.description:
Small planters are a planter variant that can be placed in less spacious areas. It can hold a maximum of 3 separate plants, including corn, hemp, and pumpkin.

Seeds placed in a planter grow 2x as fast as they would normally on wild ground. Being exposed to light (be it natural sunlight or artificial ceiling lamps) further increases the growth time to 4x the normal speed. Planters also grant you the ability to water the plants, which significantly increases their yield when harvested. A fully matured hemp plant produces 10 cloth normally, but can produce up to 40 cloth when watered properly.

To fill your planter with water, simply fill a bucket/water jug with clean water and dump it straight onto your planter. The maximum amount of water the small planter box can hold at once is 3000ml.

stash.small.name: かくし箱
stash.small.description:
Small stashes are a very useful tool in the early game, especially when saving enough resources to build a starter base, or hiding your key to your door.

Place it where you want it, fill it with up to 6 different items or stacks of items, and interact with it to bury it. After staring at the stash's general location for a couple of seconds, the stash will rise out of the ground and will be able to be accessed again.

stocking.small.name: スモール ストッキング
stocking.small.description: A small stocking. Hang it by a fire and you might just get a gift! Collect 6 to upgrade to a SUPER Stocking.

sign.wooden.small.name: 小さな看板
sign.wooden.small.description: This is the smallest sign available. You can paint on the sign using the in-game image editor. Signs are useful for indicating prices for shops and more.

snowman.name: スノーマン
snowman.description: Get into the holiday spirit with this decorative snowman.

sofa.name: ソファ
sofa.description: A comfortable old sofa. A decorative item which provides comfort and seats two.

sofa.pattern.name: パターンソファ
sofa.pattern.description: A comfortable old sofa with a floral pattern. A decorative item which provides comfort and seats two.

spinner.wheel.name: スピンボード
spinner.wheel.description: The spinning wheel, when placed, allows any authorized player to paint the wheel. Players may spin the wheel, landing on a randomized location. There is no practical use for the wheel beyond that of roleplaying, gambling, or aesthetics.

fireplace.stone.name: 石だんろ
fireplace.stone.description: A stone fireplace to heat your home. Must be placed indoors and against a wall.

storage_barrel_c.name: ヨコのストレージバレル
storage_barrel_c.description: Keep your things in this wooden barrel. Stores up to 48 items. Cannot be locked.

storage_barrel_b.name: タテのストレージバレル
storage_barrel_b.description: Keep your things in this wooden barrel. Stores up to 48 items. Cannot be locked.

fishtrap.small.name: 原始的なサバイバルフィッシュトラップ
fishtrap.small.description: Fish traps are a great source of Food, Animal Fat, and Bones during the early and midgame. After placing bait into the trap's inventory, either small fish or trout will be caught, depending on the total calorie value of the bait in the trap. Multiple pieces of bait can be consumed at once if it means catching larger fish. Fish traps lose 10 durability whenever they catch a fish.

table.name: テーブル
table.description: Every home needs a table. A decorative item which provides comfort when in close proximity.

sign.pictureframe.tall.name: がくぶち (背高)
sign.pictureframe.tall.description: A tall canvas for artists paintings.

gunrack_tall.horizontal.name: トールウェポンラック
gunrack_tall.horizontal.description: Artfully display your arsenal with a handcrafted wall-mounted weapon rack.

torchholder.name: たいまつホルダー
torchholder.description: A wall mounted holder for torches.

tunalight.name: ツナ缶のランプ
tunalight.description:
A Makeshift wall light.

Can be attached to walls only. Runs on Low Grade Fuel and consumes 1 per 10 minutes.

trophy.name: Twitchライバルトロフィー
trophy.description: A trophy dedicated to the survivors of Rust Twitch Rivals

trophy2023.name: Twitch Rivals 2023トロフィー
trophy2023.description: A trophy dedicated to the survivors of Rust Twitch Rivals 2023

sign.hanging.name: りょう面吊り下げ看板
sign.hanging.description: A double sided hanging sign, to attach to buildings.

sign.hanging.ornate.name: りょう面吊り看板
sign.hanging.ornate.description: A double sided hanging sign, to attach to buildings.

sign.post.town.roof.name: ナワバリのダブルひょうしき
sign.post.town.roof.description:
The Two sided Town Sign post is a sign post that you can place anywhere in the terrain.
It is very similar to the normal sign holders, except this can be placed anywhere except the walls.

It's not something you have, same as the other sign holders, but a skin you can buy on the market.

vending.machine.name: じはんき
vending.machine.description:
The Vending Machine provides a safe way to make indirect trade with other players. Anyone who has access to the rear side of the Vending Machine can edit the machine's Buy/Sell orders and modify the contents. Once a Buy/Sell order has been set up, players simply need to walk up to the front of the machine and interact with it. A list of trades will appear on their screen and (provided they have the right materials to complete the transaction) can choose a trade. The process is automatic and requires little to no management (after the orders have been setup).

Selling high valued items could make you more of a raid target, and although players can't get the machine's contents without access to the rear side of the machine, having a shop inside your base is risky. Vending Machines can also be used to lure in unsuspecting buyers into a trap base.

wallpaper.name: ウォールペーパー
wallpaper.description: Transform your base from a rusty shack to a cozy hideout with this sleek wallpaper. A nice touch of style - until the next raid, at least.

wantedposter.name: WANTEDポスター
wantedposter.description: A poster that can display a given player's face as wanted.

water.barrel.name: 水ダル
water.barrel.description:
The water barrel is a container used to store excess water for later. It is capable of holding up to 20,000 ml of water at a time.
After farming 2.0 update,water barrel can give water to other items through the water pipe

water.purifier.name: じょう水器
water.purifier.description: The water purifier is a useful tool as an early game solution for obtaining clean drinking water. You can only place the water purifier on top of a campfire, while the campfire is active, the salt water is filtered out of the propane tank and flows into the bucket, for easy consumption or storage.

gunrack_stand.name: ウェポンラックスタンド
gunrack_stand.description: Holds weaponry haphazardly, a charmingly chaotic addition to your virtual armory.

gunrack_wide.horizontal.name: ワイドウェポンラック
gunrack_wide.horizontal.description: Artfully display your arsenal with a handcrafted wall-mounted weapon rack.

box.wooden.name: 小さい木箱
box.wooden.description:
A Wood Storage Box is a small box with the ability to store a maximum of 18 separate items or stacks of items inside of it. These can often times be used as a more space efficient way to store your items than the Large Wood Box, but can prove difficult to keep sorted as not all of your items are in one container.

They can have both locks and codelocks placed on them to keep unwanted newmans at bay for a brief period. If destroyed, they will destroy a portion of their contents as well. Boxes can be placed on shelves to save space.

workbench1.name: ワークベンチ Lv.1
workbench1.description: The tier 1 Work Bench acts as a gateway towards crafting early game gear, including salvaged weapons and armor. You can find them at the Scientist Outpost and the Bandit Camp monuments.

workbench2.name: ワークベンチ Lv.2
workbench2.description: The tier 2 Work bench allows you to craft mid-game weapons, armor, and building parts while in the vicinity of the work bench. Uses the same amount of space like the Tier One Workbench

workbench3.name: ワークベンチ Lv.3
workbench3.description: The tier 3 Work Bench allows you to craft the highest tier of weapons, armor, and defenses.

sign.pictureframe.xl.name: がくぶち(大)
sign.pictureframe.xl.description: An extra large canvas for artists paintings.

sign.pictureframe.xxl.name: がくぶち（巨大）
sign.pictureframe.xxl.description: The XXL Picture Frame is a very large canvas that allows players to draw artistic paintings and drawings onto. It can be placed on walls and some other surfaces. Can be locked from other players editing it.

fat.animal.name: どうぶつの脂肪
fat.animal.description: Fat is a good package for biological energy, making it quite an effective fuel source. It can be taken from any animal, including humans.

battery.small.name: バッテリー（小）
battery.small.description: Small batteries are only obtainable through the console with sufficient permissions. It currently has no use.

bone.fragments.name: 骨の破片
bone.fragments.description: Bone fragments are obtainable from any corpse and used in armor and tools.

cctv.camera.name: CCTVカメラ
cctv.camera.description:
A CCTV Camera can be placed down to capture video footage and sound when powered and paired with a Computer Station.

A CCTV Camera has its own unique ID used to pair with a Computer Station. Once the CCTV Camera is powered with 5 rWm, the ID will then be available for anyone to pair with their own Computer Station. Always keep the IDs randomized as people can find out your camera IDs to monitor your base.

charcoal.name: 木炭
charcoal.description: Charcoal is the byproduct of wood when used for smelting in a campfire or furnace. It is used in conjunction with sulfur to craft gunpowder, a key ingredient for ammunition and explosives. Though it may be tempting to throw charcoal away, large quantities will be required in later stages of the game. Keep it if you can.

cloth.name: 布
cloth.description: Cloth is a basic resource that has several means of being harvested. Most commonly it is farmed with hemp and hemp seeds, but can be gathered from animals and even cacti with the appropriate tools. It is used primarily for clothing, and the refining of low grade when combined with animal fat. To make cloth gathering a trivial task, the proper use of planters is recommended.

coal.name: 石炭
coal.description: Coal can only be obtained from stockings and presents during Christmas time. It has no other uses aside from recycling and filling people's inventory with them.

crude.oil.name: 原油
crude.oil.description: Raw Oil out of the ground, must be refined in a refinery to be used. Can be found in barrels scattered across the map.

diesel_barrel.name: ディーゼル 燃料
diesel_barrel.description: Appropriate fuel for the Giant Excavator Pit monument, can be found in the Dome, Junkyard, Small/Large Oil Rig or purchased with 300 Low Grade Fuel in Outpost.

can.beans.empty.name: からっぽのマメ缶
can.beans.empty.description: An empty can of beans are what's left after eating a can of beans. They can be smelted in a campfire to give metal fragments.

can.tuna.empty.name: からっぽのツナ缶
can.tuna.empty.description:
After consuming a tuna can, you'll be left with its empty remains.
Empty tuna cans are used for either smelting them into a few Metal Fragments, or to make the Tuna Can Lamp.

explosives.name: ばくやく
explosives.description: Explosives are used in more powerful raiding devices. They cannot be used on their own, only as an ingredient.

fertilizer.name: ひりょう
fertilizer.description: Helps plants grow by increasing ground condition. Produced in a composter.

gunpowder.name: かやく
gunpowder.description:
Gunpowder is a resource created by combining smelted sulfur and charcoal. It is used for multiple things from rockets, grenades, ammunition, and even land mines.

As this is used almost exclusively for PvP purposes, this is a much sought after resource and should be protected and seized at every opportunity.

metal.refined.name: 上金属
metal.refined.description: High Quality Metal is considered as a rare resource used for crafting metal items such as armor, doors, weapons and more. High Quality Metal is often used as the 'top-tier' when constructing or upgrading building blocks.

hq.metal.ore.name: こうせき（上金属）
hq.metal.ore.description: A rock containing High Quality Metal. Can be smelted in a furnace.

skull.human.name: スカル
skull.human.description: The skull of a human, harvest-able from other dead players. Displays the name of the victim you harvested the skull from.

leather.name: 毛皮
leather.description: One of the resources commonly acquired through harvesting most animals. It's necessary for the making of mid and end tier armors, needed by every Rust player. Acquired in abundance mainly through the harvesting of bears and wolves.

lowgradefuel.name: 低しつ燃料
lowgradefuel.description: Low Grade Fuel is a resource made from Animal Fat and Cloth. It is required early game to make furnaces and mid game for Syringes. There are three ways to get this, hunting animals (or to a lesser effect, humans) and crafting it, refining crude oil at a monument or personal refinery, and finding it in oil barrels (or to a lesser effect in mine carts).

metal.fragments.name: 金属片
metal.fragments.description: Metal Fragments. Smelted from Metal Ore, used in lots of different crafting recipes.

metal.ore.name: こうせき（金属）
metal.ore.description: Metal ore can be smelted into metal fragments through a furnace which is used to craft most of the tools, structures, items and weaponry throughout the game and is vital to have during most of the time being.

paper.name: ペーパー
paper.description: Paper used to be an ingredient to make notes, now only wood is required and paper has been since forgotten, maybe it will come back in the future to be used in other crafting.

plantfiber.name: 植物せんい
plantfiber.description: Fiber from dead plants. Can be composted.

water.radioactive.name: RADウォーター
water.radioactive.description: Glowing water. Consuming will damage your health and irradiate you.

researchpaper.name: リサーチペーパー
researchpaper.description: Research Paper Used to be used in research to create items, this is no longer the case and scrap is used for researching items.

water.salt.name: 海水
water.salt.description: Salt water is similar to normal water, but it does more harm than good and is gathered from the sea. Drinking salt water will make you vomit, losing health and hydration. Salt water can be purified using a water purifier.

scrap.name: スクラップ
scrap.description:
Resource mainly used for researching items into blueprints at workbenches or going down the tech tree, which allows for targeting certain items you want to acquire.

It's also a type of currency, used for trading various items at the Scientist Outpost and the Bandit Camp. As such, Scrap is very valuable and essential at any point in the game.

stones.name: 石
stones.description: Stones are an abundant and vital resource as they can be earned from any node and have the best cost-to-protection ratio for base building.

sulfur.name: 硫黄
sulfur.description: One of the most valuable and sought after resources in rust, sulfur is useful to almost all players (with the exception of freshspawns) due to it being required to craft gunpowder, a resource necessary to create ammo as well as any explosive. It can be found in its ore form in sulfur nodes, identifiable by their distinct yellow colouring. This then needs to be smelted in a furnace in order to obtain its purified form seen here.

sulfur.ore.name: こうせき（硫黄）
sulfur.ore.description: Sulfur ore is a resource found in Sulfur nodes. Smelting sulfur ore in any furnace will give sulfur, an ingredient in crafting gunpowder.

targeting.computer.name: コンピューター部品
targeting.computer.description: Used for crafting auto turrets, or recycling a large amounts of scrap.

recycleYieldrad.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

recycleYieldsafe.name:
武器ボックスの他に、CCTVカメラやPCリサイクルからもゲットできる。
C4やレーザーサイト、ホロサイトをクラフトするのに使う。
（リサイクラー：スクラップ・上金属）

water.name: ウォーター
water.description:
Water can be used to regain thirst, heal yourself and remove radiation poisoning.

You can either get it from water collectors, drink it from rivers, streams and lakes or from water bottles found in the ration loot boxes.

skull.wolf.name: オオカミのずがいこつ
skull.wolf.description: The wolf skull allows players to craft the wolf headdress. Can be smashed for bone fragments.

wood.name: 木材
wood.description: Wood is possibly the most basic resource in the game. It is used for laying out twig structures, fuel for furnaces/campfires, early stage armor and weapons, furniture/storage, and so on. It is gathered relatively quickly, but is consumed very fast.

barrelcostume.name: バレルのコスチューム
barrelcostume.description: A stupid barrel costume, so you can hide like a pro..p

hazmatsuit_scientist_arctic.name: サイエンティストスーツ（ホワイト）
hazmatsuit_scientist_arctic.description: An Arctic Scientist Suit worn by the scientists which are found in arctic research bases. Unobtainable during normal gameplay, it can only be acquired through console by admins.

hazmatsuit.arcticsuit.name: アークティック スーツ
hazmatsuit.arcticsuit.description: An arctic variant of the hazmat suit which trades radiation for cold protection.

mask.bandana.name: 口をおおうフェイスマスク。とてもあたたかい。
mask.bandana.description: Cheap facial attire compatible with most head slots that wouldn't otherwise obscure it.

attire.banditguard.name: バンディット ガードギア
attire.banditguard.description: A Bandit Guard Suit worn by the guards at bandit camp. Unobtainable during normal gameplay, it can only be acquired through console by admins.

hat.cap.name: ベースボールキャップ
hat.cap.description: Equivalent stats to beenie hat while costing less and requiring the steam item.

horse.shoes.basic.name: ウマのていてつ
horse.shoes.basic.description: Equipping these horse shoes will grant your horse additional movement speed

hat.beenie.name: ブーニーハット
hat.beenie.description: Equivalent stats to baseball cap while being more expensive and requiring research to create.

jumpsuit.suit.blue.name: ブルーのジャンプスーツ

bone.armor.suit.name: ボーンのアーマー
bone.armor.suit.description:
Respectable projectile and melee resistance has promoted bone armor to a heightened status within the primitive era.

Its slot efficiency is often exploited during helicopter patrols.

deer.skull.mask.name: ボーンのヘルメット
deer.skull.mask.description: Second only to the wolf headdress in primitive headwear, the bone helmet is a welcome sink for bone frags until metal can take its place.

hat.boonie.name: ブーニーハット
hat.boonie.description: Equivalent stats and cost to burlap headwrap, but can be combined with the bandana.

shoes.boots.name: ブーツ
shoes.boots.description:
